Algorithm

Class Auto

  • java.lang.Object
    • Algorithm.Auto

  • public class Auto
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the info in order to play automatic game it contains the shortest path that the player should go, checks if two points are divided by box
    Author:
    Chen Ostrovski, Ester Reznikov

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Auto(Robot.Play play)
      This method get all the info for the auto game: it gets all the block, fruits and player locations

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean blockedbybox(Geom.Point3D source, Geom.Point3D target, java.util.ArrayList<Geom.Point3D[]> boxes)
      This method Goes through all the possibilities of positioning two points so that they are not cut by box every box divided into 4 part, when the upper left corner marked as [0] the lower right corner marked as [2]
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> closestFruit(Geom.Point3D player, double velocity)
      This method finds the shortest path of a player by finding the closest fruits to him
      java.util.ArrayList<Fruit> getFruits() 
      Robot.Play getPlay() 
      Player getPlayer() 
      static graph.Node nextpoint(Geom.Point3D source, Geom.Point3D target, Boxinfo boxinfo)
      Auxiliary function that help the function above to find path between two points in order to find the shortest path
      static boolean pathcutbybox(Geom.Point3D source, Geom.Point3D target, Geom.Point3D[] box)
      Auxiliary function that help the function above to check if two points are cut by box the function is used when source and target are not located in the same area relative to the box by using a straight equation
      void setPlayer(Player player) 
      void setstart()
      This method set the start location of the player under certain conditions

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> closestFruit(Geom.Point3D player,
                                                          double velocity)
        This method finds the shortest path of a player by finding the closest fruits to him

        velocity - the velocity of the player

                                   Geom.Point3D target,
                                   Boxinfo boxinfo)
        Auxiliary function that help the function above to find path between two points in order to find the shortest path
        Parameters:
        source - the first point location
        target - the second point location
        boxinfo - the info of every box in the game
        Returns:

      • blockedbybox

        public static boolean blockedbybox(Geom.Point3D source,
                                   Geom.Point3D target,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<Geom.Point3D[]> boxes)
        This method Goes through all the possibilities of positioning two points so that they are not cut by box every box divided into 4 part, when the upper left corner marked as [0] the lower right corner marked as [2]
        Parameters:
        source - the first point location
        target - the second point location
        boxes - the info of the corners in every box in the game
        Returns:
        true: if the points not blocked false: if the points blocked

      • pathcutbybox

        public static boolean pathcutbybox(Geom.Point3D source,
                                   Geom.Point3D target,
                                   Geom.Point3D[] box)
        Auxiliary function that help the function above to check if two points are cut by box the function is used when source and target are not located in the same area relative to the box by using a straight equation
        Parameters:
        source - the first point location
        target - the second point location
        box - the info of the corners in every box in the game
        Returns:
        true : if the path is not cut by box false : if the path is cut by box
